document.docAuthor: Siewert, Ricardo Russo, Mielke, Olaf Hermann Hendrik & Casagrande, Mirna Martins
document.masterDocTitle: Taxonomic revision of the Neotropical genus Telemiades Hübner, [1819] (Lepidoptera: Hesperiidae: Eudaminae), with descriptions of fourteen new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Taxonomic revision of the Neotropical genus Telemiades Hübner, [1819] (Lepidoptera: Hesperiidae: Eudaminae), with descriptions of fourteen new species

subSubSection.paragraph:
Eudamus laogonus Hewitson, 1876
. Ann. & Mag. Nat. Hist. (4)18 : 354; Brazil ; Staudinger collection.

Telegonus laogonus
; Kirby, 1877 . Syn. Cat. Diurn. Lep., Suppl. , p. 817.

Proteides nicola Plötz, 1882
. Berl. ent. Ztschr. 26 : 71; n° 5.037 [ holotype ], Pará [ Brazil ]; Mus. Berol.— Godman, 1907 . Ann. & Mag. Nat. Hist. (7)20 : 135. syn. nov.

; Mabille & Boullet, 1919. Ann. Sc. nat., Zool. , Paris, (10)2 : 208, 209.— Draudt, 1922 , in Seitz. Gross–Schmett. Erde 5 , p. 878, pl. 170f (d, v).— Shepard, 1931 . Lep. Cat. 47 , p. 119.

Telemiades laogonus nicola
; Evans, 1953 . Cat. Amer. Hesp. 3 , p. 31.—K. Brown & Mielke, 1967. Jour. Lep. Soc. 21 : 161.— Bridges, 1983. Lep. Hesp. 1 , p. 81; 2 , p. 36.—Bridges, 1988. Cat. Hesp. 1 , p. 129; 2 , p. 60.— Mielke, 2004 . Hesperioidea, p. 56, in Lamas (ed.). Checklist: Part 4A, Hesperioidea–Papilionoidea , in Heppner (ed.).

(no genus)
laogonus
; Beattie, 1976. Rhop. Direct ., p. 180.

(no genus)
nicola
; Bridges, 1976. Rhop. Direct ., p. 212.

(no genus)
simplicius
; Beattie, 1976. Rhop. Direct ., p. 260.

Type material.
Eudamus laogonus Hewitson, 1876
was described based on an unspecified number of specimens from Brazil from the Otto Staudinger collection. One male syntype was found at ZMHU , where the Staudinger material is housed, with the same characteristics published in the original description, and illustrated on Butterflies of America (
Warren et al . 2018
) with the following labels: / Typus/ Brasilia Capta D. Swainson./ Laogonus / Coll. Sommer/ Coll. Staudinger/
laogonus Hw.
/. In order to stabilize the identity of this species, this male specimen is hereby designated lectotype of
Eudamus laogonus Hewitson, 1876
and the following labels will be attached: / Lectotypus / Lectotypus
Eudamus laogonus Hewitson, 1876 Siewert, Mielke & Casagrande
det. 2019/. These labels will be sent to the curator for the collection.

Proteides nicola Plötz, 1882
was described based on the male holotype from Pará, Brazil . The male holotype is deposited at the ZMHU and illustrated on Butterflies of America (
Warren et al . 2018
) with the following labels: / Holotypus Nr./ 5037/ Pará Sieb/
nicola Pl.
Type/.

Telemiades simplicius Hayward, 1933
was described based on the female holotype and on one male paratype from Misiones, Argentina . The female holotype is deposited at the MLP with the following labels: / Iguazu, Argentina , A. Breyer, X–1928 / Tipus/
Telemiades simplicius Holotipo
♀ Hayward/ 2523/.

Diagnosis. FW length: males 15–17 mm (n=10) and females 17–18 mm (n=5).
Telemiades laogonus
is the only species of the genus with irregular margin in HW with a small projection in M 3 –CuA 1 and CuA 1 –CuA 2 and the tornus rounded. Additionally, the following genitalia characters differs
T. laogonus
from other species of the genus: tegumen with short apophysys, about 1/3 the size of uncus; valva with dorsal margin concave; harpe triangular with distal margin serrated; lamella antevaginalis laterally slightly sclerotized; lamella antevaginalis with distal margin bilobed and laterally with a thin–like projection; proximal margin bifid, triangular, ventrally with a small area covered by small scales and extending in a thin–like projection.
Variation. Some specimens have two hyaline spots below the apicals in M 1 –M 2 and M 2 –M 3 .

Distribution.
Telemiades laogonus
is widely distributed in South America, with records in forested areas of French Guiana , Peru , Bolivia , Brazil and Argentina .

Taxonomic discussion.
Eudamus laogonus Hewitson, 1876
was transferred to the genus
Telegonus Hübner, [1819]
by Kirby (1877) and later to
Telemiades
by Hayward (1947b) . In this same study, Hayward (1947b) synonymized
Proteides nicola Plötz, 1882
,
Plesioneura lamus Mabille, 1888
and
Telemiades simplicius Hayward, 1933
with
Telemiades laogonus
. After Hayward’s study (1947b),
Plesioneura lamus
and
Telemiades simplicius
were treated as synonyms of
Telemiades avitus
and
T. laogonus
by Evans (1953) , respectively, while
Proteides nicola
was interpreted as a subspecies of
T. laogonus
. The analysis of the type material of
P. nicola
syn. nov.
(besides the series of specimens analyzed here) supports the hypothesis of a synonym of
T. laogonus
. The character that Evans (1953) used to separate the two subspecies of
T. laogonus
(presence or absence of the costal spot in FW) is variable. Specimens collected in the same locality may vary with respect to this feature.
Examined material. No data: 1 male (ZSM); 1 female , NHMUK 010242373 (NHMUK).
